title: José José, Mexican crooner hailed as ‘The Prince of Song’ who pulled the heartstrings with songs drawing from his own turbulent life – obituary
text:
José José ,who has died aged 71, earned a reputation as one of Mexico’s top pop crooners, moving audiences to tears with lachrymose songs about las mujeres, el amor and el corazón and selling millions of copies of dozens of albums around the world; he became known as the “Prince of Song”.

José José, who spent much of his career in South Florida, fashioned himself after Frank Sinatra. Often clad in a smart business suit or tuxedo on stage, he struck a world-weary pose and his vocal delivery combined power and range with an attractive air of soulful vulnerability. At concerts beefy bodyguards were required to protect him from overheated female fans who would keep storming the stage to kiss him;...
